details.description: The Copenhagen Lounger was made during a two-month study abroad in Copenhagen, Denmark. The lounger was designed after a weeklong study tour of Finland and Sweden and the study of the history of Danish functionalism. The entire chair is made of beech veneer formed using a vacuum-bagging technique to mold both the chair and backrest components, which were later, joined with a walnut dowel.
details.name: Copenhagen Lounger

details.description: Dream^4 is an experiment installation regarding to connecting people by their dreams automatically & manually.
details.name: Dream^4

modules.text: Dream4 is an experimental project which uses people’s dream as a way to match people who may have similar dreams in the real world. The “4“ means that this connection brings no-dimensional dream to our physical 4-dimentional world.
modules.text_plain: Dream4 is an experimental project which uses people’s dream as a way to match people who may have similar dreams in the real world. The “4“ means that this connection brings no-dimensional dream to our physical 4-dimentional world.

details.description: This is a widget/function concept embedded into the digital map such as Google Maps. By clicking the weather button, users can activate the weather filter function. People can modify seasons, weather conditions, where it is day or night and the temperature range to filter pictures of places.
details.name: Google Maps Weather Filter Concept

modules.text: Weather Maps is a widget/function concept embedded into Google Maps. By clicking the weather button, users can activate the weather filter function.
modules.text_plain: Weather Maps is a widget/function concept embedded into Google Maps. By clicking the weather button, users can activate the weather filter function.

modules.text: You can modify seasons, weather conditions, where it is day or night and the temperature range to filter pictures of places.
modules.text_plain: You can modify seasons, weather conditions, where it is day or night and the temperature range to filter pictures of places.

modules.text: You also can turn on the temperature button to let the photo display the temperature parameters in a small icon located in the corner of the photo.
modules.text_plain: You also can turn on the temperature button to let the photo display the temperature parameters in a small icon located in the corner of the photo.

modules.text: When people click a specific photo, they also can press the “weather icon” in each picture to see the photos of the place in various weather conditions.
modules.text_plain: When people click a specific photo, they also can press the “weather icon” in each picture to see the photos of the place in various weather conditions.

details.description: An exploration of the relationship of scale within interior architecture.
details.name: What is Interior Architecture?

modules.text: Interior Architecture is driven by the human body.  It caters / reacts / fits / controls / emphasizes / distorts / manipulates / predicts / holds / molds to / supports / guides / etc. how the body will move and feel in space. For this project I had to create a paper model for the human scale. If we look at the model at a one to one scale it functions as a protective garment - fitting the body while camouflaging the form. But if we imagine the model to be at 1/8” scale it suddenly becomes a cavernous space the body can freely wander through and explore.
modules.text_plain: Interior Architecture is driven by the human body.  It caters / reacts / fits / controls / emphasizes / distorts / manipulates / predicts / holds / molds to / supports / guides / etc. how the body will move and feel in space. For this project I had to create a paper model for the human scale. If we look at the model at a one to one scale it functions as a protective garment - fitting the body while camouflaging the form. But if we imagine the model to be at 1/8” scale it suddenly becomes a cavernous space the body can freely wander through and explore.

details.description: We are always bound by walls but what happens within walls...
details.name: Within Walls

modules.text:
This project was centered around creating a moment of escape/reflection within the fast paced lifestyle of New York City. Working within the lower level and outside patio areas of the Whitney Museum, I wanted to create a procession where an individual would shed the stress of everyday to reach a point of unhindered inner meditation.
I questioned the role of the walls as mere agents of space creation in this project and started questioning what might it be like to see past the surface into the space within walls.
modules.text_plain: This project was centered around creating a moment of escape/reflection within the fast paced lifestyle of New York City. Working within the lower level and outside patio areas of the Whitney Museum, I wanted to create a procession where an individual would shed the stress of everyday to reach a point of unhindered inner meditation.I questioned the role of the walls as mere agents of space creation in this project and started questioning what might it be like to see past the surface into the space within walls.

modules.text: After descending the existing stairs, the visitor will enter the first “room.” A traditional space made of four walls with a bench along one side, this vestibule is meant as a space to prepare for journey. As they pass through the thresholds, they will begin to notice a space filled with light progressively growing between each wall they pass. The journey will reach full circle in the last room. Another space made up of four walls? Or a space within walls?
modules.text_plain: After descending the existing stairs, the visitor will enter the first “room.” A traditional space made of four walls with a bench along one side, this vestibule is meant as a space to prepare for journey. details.description:
2013 
Handmade postcards: inkjet on semi-glossy paper and cardstock 

Can Someone Talk With Me is a collaborative project that explores parallels, intersections, and conflicts between modes of online and offline communication, seeking a relationship between the digital and the analogue. The project cultivates opportunities for individuals to respond to expressions of loneliness on the social media platform Twitter via physical postcards in the “real” world, thus recontextualizing anonymous digital communication. 

This expresses one phase of the project which exists in physical space as interactions with the public and their responses in the form of postcards. The second phase, if successful, will exist online as a functioning and interactive Twitter account, and hopefully as ongoing private correspondances. 

Collaborators: David Kim, Nupur Mathur, Hyo Jin Yoo, and Chihao Yo.
details.name: Can someone talk with me?

modules.text:
WHAT IS HOME?
my own bed is
I can be naked, both emotionally and physically.
my wife/husband is
is not a place but a feeling.
a warm dog curled up by my feet at bedtime
I don’t have to be perfect.
there is the smell of my mother’s perfume.
my palm meets my daughter’s palm. 
a good man, a good chair, and a good wine.
...

modules.text: 1.EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN
modules.text_plain: 1.EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN

modules.text: Mental Home is where our "real home" is in our memory which can be our hometown or the place our lover is. Physical home is where we live now. It may be our Mental Home, or just a living place. Can we try to make people feel more "home" within or outside of their physical home?
modules.text_plain: Mental Home is where our "real home" is in our memory which can be our hometown or the place our lover is. Physical home is where we live now. It may be our Mental Home, or just a living place. Can we try to make people feel more "home" within or outside of their physical home?

modules.text:
+Bring home with you - Home Twitter
The device will rotate 360 degree to take photo of home then tweet image and text to twitter. It will tweet some emotional feeling as a human being like “The house is very clean today”, “Ohh! You forgot turn off the stove!” and “Help! Someone broke into the house”
modules.text_plain: +Bring home with you - Home TwitterThe device will rotate 360 degree to take photo of home then tweet image and text to twitter. It will tweet some emotional feeling as a human being like “The house is very clean today”, “Ohh! You forgot turn off the stove!” and “Help! Someone broke into the house”

modules.text:
+Connect with home wherever you are - Home Connection
It is a clock device that can help people far from home to connect their physical home with the mental home. With the 360 degree base, people can see their home in a more real way. Also they can communicate with the home member and feel the warm wind from “home”.
modules.text_plain: +Connect with home wherever you are - Home ConnectionIt is a clock device that can help people far from home to connect their physical home with the mental home. With the 360 degree base, people can see their home in a more real way. Also they can communicate with the home member and feel the warm wind from “home”.

modules.text: 2.DISCURSIVE DESIGN
modules.text_plain: 2.DISCURSIVE DESIGN

modules.text: Scientifically, human use prefrontal cortex processes experiences, using sensory input from the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, sorts them into categories, and tags the various memory fragments with specific associations to recall them. So there should be a “space” in our brain that contains our most original “home” feeling.
modules.text_plain: Scientifically, human use prefrontal cortex processes experiences, using sensory input from the eyes, ears, nose and mouth, sorts them into categories, and tags the various memory fragments with specific associations to recall them. So there should be a “space” in our brain that contains our most original “home” feeling.

modules.text:
+Feel the home - Home Box
I created two boxes of two people's “home” feeling. The box contained the image, smell, sound and touch feeling and users can look into and hold the box to feel their inner “home”.
modules.text_plain: +Feel the home - Home BoxI created two boxes of two people's “home” feeling. The box contained the image, smell, sound and touch feeling and users can look into and hold the box to feel their inner “home”.

modules.text:
+The moment of home - Music Teeth Brush
When people use this brush, they can choose the flavor of toothpaste that reminds them most of their home. When people turn the teeth brush on, they will hear the “home-like” sound from the toothbrush. Because people hear the "sound of home" from bone deduction, it will make them feel that the sound is from their inner body. Furthermore, the stick they hold is covered the “home-like” texture. Finally people can close their eyes, imagine the visual image in their memory to recall their “home” from the indicators of the sound, texture, smell and taste.
modules.text_plain: +The moment of home - Music Teeth BrushWhen people use this brush, they can choose the flavor of toothpaste that reminds them most of their home. When people turn the teeth brush on, they will hear the “home-like” sound from the toothbrush. Because people hear the "sound of home" from bone deduction, it will make them feel that the sound is from their inner body. Furthermore, the stick they hold is covered the “home-like” texture. Finally people can close their eyes, imagine the visual image in their memory to recall their “home” from the indicators of the sound, texture, smell and taste.

details.description:
2013 
Appropriated images, paper 

Journey to the West appropriates images collected from the internet and reformats them into a three-dimensional collage. Using my own personal experience as a starting point, it is a representation of an online culture which is based in the approximate, filtered understanding of existing cultures offline. The title - based off the a classic Chinese novel about a Buddhist pilgrimage - is a reference to the transfer of Eastern entertainment culture to Western countries. My goal was to use these images to portray a slice of that online culture in a way that indicates its own existence... Not to portray it as its most well-known stereotypes or tropes, but as its own entity as it manifests itself in the identities of its participants. 

This piece was exhibited in ALL THAT GLITTERS IS NOT LEDS, the RISD digital+media biennial in Providence, RI in 2013.
details.name: Journey to the West

details.description: Using the game of chess as a starting off point, I created a chess club in the heart of downtown Providence that mutates the way players play and interact with one another.
details.name: Intersect/Mutate

modules.text: In this project I adaptively reused an old row house in downtown Providence to create a chess club for the local community. An investigation into the game of chess led me to a concept of mutation upon intersection. After analyzing the idea of mutation, I applied my concept to create a space for chess.
modules.text_plain: In this project I adaptively reused an old row house in downtown Providence to create a chess club for the local community. An investigation into the game of chess led me to a concept of mutation upon intersection. After analyzing the idea of mutation, I applied my concept to create a space for chess.

modules.text: The site was located between two parallel major roads.  Situated on a corner that led into a utility alley, we were permitted to venture out of the building and occupy the alley.  The site is visible from Weybosset St across a parking lot.
modules.text_plain: The site was located between two parallel major roads.  Situated on a corner that led into a utility alley, we were permitted to venture out of the building and occupy the alley.  The site is visible from Weybosset St across a parking lot.

modules.text:
The project was started with an analyisis of the game of chess.  We were asked to create a 3d diagram that depicted 4 consecutive moves of three assigned pieces (I was given pawn, knight, rook).
From my diagrams and anyalysis led me to a discovery - whenever pieces occupied the same space there was a moment of intersection that led to mutation.
modules.text_plain: The project was started with an analyisis of the game of chess.  We were asked to create a 3d diagram that depicted 4 consecutive moves of three assigned pieces (I was given pawn, knight, rook).From my diagrams and anyalysis led me to a discovery - whenever pieces occupied the same space there was a moment of intersection that led to mutation.

modules.text:
Translating the idea of intersection/mutation into the space, I started with the idea of the floor mutating into a ramp where the axis of the two floors met.  The idea of mutation, however, wasn't strong enough with just a ramp so I started folding paper.  From there I discovered that the reason folded paper was a stronger mutation was for two reasons:
1 - You could clrealy see what the paper was before.
2 - The folding followed a clear, repetivtive set of rules in mutating.
 
I took what I learned from the paper folding to mutate the ramp further into a playing field.
modules.text_plain: Translating the idea of intersection/mutation into the space, I started with the idea of the floor mutating into a ramp where the axis of the two floors met.  The idea of mutation, however, wasn't strong enough with just a ramp so I started folding paper.  From there I discovered that the reason folded paper was a stronger mutation was for two reasons:1 - You could clrealy see what the paper was before.2 - The folding followed a clear, repetivtive set of rules in mutating. I took what I learned from the paper folding to mutate the ramp further into a playing field.

modules.text: The mutation extends to the outside via the stairs. Facing the main road benches and tables offer players a chance to play al fresco.
modules.text_plain: The mutation extends to the outside via the stairs. Facing the main road benches and tables offer players a chance to play al fresco.

details.description:
2013 
tumblr, code 

SHIRITORI, derived from a common word chain game, plays with linking tumblr posts via search, providing an ever-changing roadmap through linking ideas via the language of tags. The site is built with HTML and javascript. The original word chain game involves multiple players creating a chain of words based off the first and last letters of a word (example: apple - elephant - telephone etc.). The process of SHIRITORI is the same except that the role of word is replaced by posts, and letters are replaced by tags. The resulting process is then: 1. Search for a term, 2. Grab a post, 3. Take a different tag from the same post, 4. Search again with new tag. 

You can access SHIRITORI at http://moriandyama.com/shiritori.
details.name: SHIRITORI

modules.text: Working in a machine shop, I found many discarded CNC cutouts of 6061 Aluminum. Taking advantage of the beautifully milled surface, I created this TIG welded polished Aluminum smartphone stand, dubbed "The Lean-Two".
modules.text_plain: Working in a machine shop, I found many discarded CNC cutouts of 6061 Aluminum. Taking advantage of the beautifully milled surface, I created this TIG welded polished Aluminum smartphone stand, dubbed "The Lean-Two".
